page.title: 16St.Andrew's Church Bells
page.content:
cont from p.16
There are three bells dated 1655, 1660 and 1705. The latter is the treble and contains the inscription "Samuel Knight made mee 1705".
One of these bells has an unusual history. In 1825 a cricket team from Medstead played an away match against West Meon. A member of the team saw the bell lying in a farmyard. It was agreed that the bell would be the prize for the match, and it was duly brought back to Medstead and after being used for a few years to bring in the labourers from the fields was hung in the belfry.
